PowerMult.desc: Percentage modifier applied to max power. 100 = 100% (no change), 400 = 400% (4x power), 50 = 50% (half power).

PowerOverride.desc: Overrides the base max power value before applying percentage multipliers. Only works with GM approval via status effects.

ResolveMult.desc: Percentage modifier applied to max resolve. 100 = 100% (no change), 400 = 400% (4x resolve), 50 = 50% (half resolve).

ResolveOverride.desc: Overrides the base max resolve value before applying percentage multipliers. Only works with GM approval via status effects.

ActionCard.DropItemHere: Drop an item here to embed it
ActionCard.StatusHint: Status effects to apply when chain conditions are met
ActionCard.SavedDescriptionHint: Description for the saved damage application
ActionCard.DropEffectHere: Drop status effects or gear here
ActionCard.EffectNotes: Effects are applied when chain conditions are met
ActionCard.DragNote: Tip: Drag items to extract copies
ActionCard.GearCategoryQuestion: Where should this gear be placed?
ActionCard.ActionItemDescription: The item that will be rolled when this action card is executed
ActionCard.EffectsDescription: Status effects and gear that will be applied when chain conditions are met

AdvanceInitiative.label: Advance Initiative
AdvanceInitiative.hint: When enabled, advances initiative after execution. Can only be used on your turn.

ActionCard.AdvanceInitiativeTurnError: You can only use this action card on your turn when 'Advance Initiative' is enabled.

AttemptInventoryReduction.label: Reduce Inventory
AttemptInventoryReduction.hint: When enabled, reduces inventory quantities when transferring gear effects.

ActionCard.GearEffectInventoryWarning: You don't have enough {gearName} in your inventory to apply this effect.
ActionCard.GearEffectNotFoundWarning: You don't have {gearName} in your inventory to apply this effect.
ActionCard.GearEffectInsufficientWarning: You don't have enough {gearName} in your inventory to apply this effect (need {required}, have {available}).

EnforceStatusChoice.label: Enforce Status Choice
EnforceStatusChoice.hint: When enabled, prevents rolling this action card if more than one status effect is selected. Users must select zero or one status effects.

ActionCard.NoTargetsForTransformation: No targets selected for transformation selection.

GmOnly.label: GM Only
GmOnly.hint: When enabled, this action card is only visible and executable by GMs. It will not be overridden by transformations and appears in a separate GM Actions tab.

Repetitions.label: Repetitions
Repetitions.hint: Roll formula for number of repetitions (e.g. '3', '1d4', '2d6+1')

RepeatToHit.label: Repeat to Hit
RepeatToHit.hint: Re-roll the embedded item for each repetition (attack chains only)

DamageApplication.label: Damage Per Success
DamageApplication.hint: Apply damage on every repetition instead of just the first success

TimingOverride.label: Timing Override (seconds)
TimingOverride.hint: Custom delay between repetitions. 0 uses system default

CostOnRepetition.label: Cost Per Repetition
CostOnRepetition.hint: When enabled, applies resource costs (power/gear) on each repetition instead of just the first

StatusApplicationLimit.label: Status Application Limit
StatusApplicationLimit.hint: Maximum times status effects can apply per execution. Set to 0 for no limit.

FailOnFirstMiss.label: Fail on First Miss
FailOnFirstMiss.hint: When enabled with 'Repeat to Hit', stops execution if the initial roll fails to trigger any damage or status effects based on their configured conditions.

ActionCard.ExecutionLimitReached: Action card execution limit reached ({limit}). Stopping further executions.
ActionCard.FirstMissFailed: Initial attack failed to meet any success conditions - no further executions will occur.
ActionCard.TransformationSelectionPrompt: This action card has multiple transformations. Choose which one to apply:
ActionCard.TransformationDuplicateNameWarning: Cannot apply transformation '{transformationName}' - character already has a transformation with the same name.
ActionCard.TransformationCursedOverrideDenied: Cannot apply transformation '{newTransformation}' - current cursed transformation '{currentTransformation}' can only be overridden by another cursed transformation.
ActionCard.TransformationNotes: Transformations are applied when action card conditions are met

Transformation.Notes: Transformations can store combat powers that are available when the character transforms.
Transformation.DropPowerHere: Drop a combat power here to add it to this transformation.
Transformation.DropActionCardHere: Drop an action card here to add it to this transformation.
Transformation.ActionCardNotes: Action cards from transformations override the character's action cards while transformed.
Transformation.ReadOnlyNote: Note: Embedded combat powers open in read-only mode. To edit a power, modify the original item in the actor's inventory.
Transformation.DragToExtract: Drag to extract this item as a new item
Transformation.DragToGroup: Drag onto another action card to create a group, or drag to actors/compendiums to extract
Transformation.DragNote: Tip: Drag items to actors, compendiums, or item tabs to create copies.
Transformation.TokenImageHint: Image to use for the token when this transformation is applied

Mode.ManualTooltip: Set manually when the formula is empty

Max.label: Maximum Power
Max.manualTooltip: Power max is set manually when the settings formula is empty
Max.derivedTooltip: Power max is automatically calculated using the formula

Max.label: Maximum Resolve
Max.manualTooltip: Resolve max is set manually when the settings formula is empty
Max.derivedTooltip: Resolve max is automatically calculated using the formula

Transformation.label: Transformation
Transformation.DragHint: Drag to share this transformation with another character

AutoTokenUpdate.label: Auto Token Update
AutoTokenUpdate.hint: Automatically update the token's image when the actor's image is updated

CombatPowers.TransformationCombatPowers: Combat powers are provided by active transformation
CombatPowers.TransformedLocked: Combat powers are provided by active transformation - cannot create new powers while transformed

ActionCards.DropItemHere: Drop features, combat powers, gear, or status effects here to create action cards
ActionCards.DropHelpText: Automatically creates action cards with embedded items ready to use
ActionCards.CreatedStatusActionCard: Created damage action card '{actionCardName}' from status '{statusName}'
ActionCards.TransformationActionCards: Action cards are provided by active transformation
ActionCards.TransformedLocked: Action cards are provided by active transformation - cannot create or modify while transformed
ActionCards.Ungrouped: Ungrouped Action Cards: Drag Together To Form Groups
ActionCards.DeleteGroupConfirm: Delete group "{name}"? Cards will be moved to ungrouped.
ActionCards.NoCardsInGroup: No action cards found in this group

PlayerActionApproval.ResultDenied: Your action '{actionCard}' has been denied by {gm}

Warnings.FieldLockedDuringTransformation: This field is locked during transformation

ScriptExplanations.ChangeTargetStatus: This script is to allow you to change the values on an existing status condition easily. Keep in mind that signed numbers will be overridden by the mode selected in the dropdown.
ScriptExplanations.DamageTargets: This script is designed to damage targets and heal selected tokens. If its in heal mode it will always heal selected over damaging targets.

Sections.Label: Label
Sections.Name: Name
Sections.EquipFirst: You need to equip this item to see details. If you want to investigate it first ask your GM.

Effect.GMPlayerMode: GM using Player Mode: As a GM, you must use targeting (right-click tokens) instead of selection. You currently have {targetCount} target(s).
Effect.NoTargets: There are no targets selected. This will create either a status condition or feature (as selected) for the compendium only.
Effect.PlayerMode: You are using the effect creator in player mode. This can only be used to create features for tokens you control. You currently have {count} tokens(s) selected.
Effect.WithTargets: There are {count} target(s) selected. This will create a status condition or feature (as selected) for each target and your compendium.

Gear.GMPlayerMode: GM using Player Mode: As a GM, you must use targeting (right-click tokens) instead of selection. You currently have {targetCount} target(s).
Gear.InsufficientQuantity: You don't have enough of this item to use it! (Need {cost}, have {quantity})
Gear.NoTargets: There are no targets selected. This will create a gear item for the compendium only.
Gear.PlayerMode: You are using the gear creator in player mode. This can only be used to create gear for tokens you control. You currently have {count} tokens(s) selected.
Gear.RestoreTarget: Restore {target}(s) Resolve, power, and selected statuses.
Gear.TargetGear: You need to target someone to use this gear!
Gear.WithTargets: There are {count} target(s) selected. This will create a gear item for each target and your compendium.

Power.InsufficientPower: You don't have enough power to use this! (Need {cost}, have {actorPower})
Power.TargetPower: You need to target someone to use this power!

Transformation.GMPlayerMode: GM using Player Mode: As a GM, you must use targeting (right-click tokens) instead of selection. You currently have {targetCount} target(s).
Transformation.NoTargets: There are no targets selected. This will create a transformation for the compendium only.
Transformation.PlayerMode: You are using the transformation creator in player mode. This can only be used to create transformations for tokens you control. You currently have {count} tokens(s) selected.
Transformation.WithTargets: There are {count} target(s) selected. This will create a transformation for each target and your compendium.

ActionCard.NoEmbeddedItem: This action card has no embedded item configured. Please add an item to the action slot before executing.
ActionCard.TargetingError: You do not have the correct targets selected for this action card.
ActionCard.TooManyStatuses: This action card requires selecting 0 or 1 status effects. Currently {count} status effects are selected. Please deselect all but one status effect to proceed.

Conversion.ActorToTransformation: Convert actor {actorName} to a transformation item. This will copy the actor's ability values, combat powers, and action cards.
Conversion.TransformationToActor: Convert transformation {transformationName} to an actor. This will create a new actor with the transformation's ability overrides and embedded items.
Conversion.ActorToTransformationGeneric: Select an actor from the world or compendiums to convert into a transformation item. This will copy the actor's ability values, combat powers, and action cards.
Conversion.TransformationToActorGeneric: Select a transformation from the world or compendiums to convert into an actor. This will create a new actor with the transformation's ability overrides and embedded items.

TokenConfigDuringTransformation.UnlinkedWarning: This token is currently transformed. Editing the token configuration while transformed could save the transformed appearance.
TokenConfigDuringTransformation.Prompt: Do you want to remove the transformation and continue?

UI.PleaseWait: Please wait for the previous operation to complete
UI.MemoryInfoUnavailable: Memory information not available in this browser
UI.TipIntervals: Keep tracked intervals below 10 for optimal performance
UI.TipMemory: Monitor memory usage during long gaming sessions
UI.TipCleanup: Use regular cleanup to maintain system performance
UI.TipForceCleanup: Use force cleanup only when experiencing serious issues

Migration.InProgress: Eventide RP System: Migration in progress. Please do not reload the world until migration is complete.
Migration.Failed: Embedded image migration failed. Check the console for details.
Migration.MigratedStatusFields: Migrated {count} action cards from statusPerSuccess to statusApplicationLimit

Notifications.TokenConfigCancelled: Token configuration cancelled. Remove the transformation first to edit the token.
Notifications.PrototypeTokenConfigCancelled: Prototype token configuration cancelled. Remove the transformation first to edit the prototype token.
Notifications.TokenConfigBlockedForPlayers: You cannot configure this token while it is transformed.
Notifications.PrototypeTokenConfigBlockedForPlayers: You cannot configure the prototype token while this actor is transformed.

ContextMenu.DeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete '{name}'?
ContextMenu.NoGroupsAvailable: No groups available. Create a group first.
ContextMenu.ConvertConfirm: Are you sure you want to convert '{name}' from {from} to {to}?

SETTINGS.MenuHint: Configure settings for the Eventide RP System.
SETTINGS.InitativeFormulaHint: Formula used to calculate initiative in combat. Cannot be empty. Leave empty and save to reset to default.
SETTINGS.InitiativeFormulaReloadPrompt: The initiative formula has been updated. It's recommended to reload the game for this change to fully take effect. Reload now?
SETTINGS.InitiativeDecimalsHint: Number of decimal places to display for initiative values.
SETTINGS.DefaultCharacterTabHint: The tab that will be active by default when opening a character sheet.
SETTINGS.DefaultDiceRollModeHint: The default visibility mode for dice rolls.
SETTINGS.AutoRollNpcInitiativeHint: Automatically roll initiative for NPCs when added to initiative.
SETTINGS.AutoRollPlayerInitiativeHint: Automatically roll initiative for players when added to initiative.
SETTINGS.HideNpcInitiativeRollsHint: Hide the initiative roll results for NPCs from players.
SETTINGS.DefaultCombatRoundDurationHint: Default duration of a combat round in seconds.
SETTINGS.SheetThemeHint: Choose a visual theme for all system applications. This affects the background, colors, and overall aesthetic of character sheets, item sheets, and other system windows.
SETTINGS.ShowGearEquipMessagesHint: If enabled, chat messages will be created when gear items are equipped or unequipped.
SETTINGS.GearEquippedDefaultHint: If enabled, gear creator will mark new gear as equipped by default.
SETTINGS.EnableActionCardChainsHint: When enabled, action cards can use attack chains to apply damage and status effects based on roll results.
SETTINGS.ActionCardExecutionDelayHint: Delay in milliseconds between each step of action card execution (0-10000ms, in 100ms increments).
SETTINGS.CrToXpFormulaHint: Formula for converting Challenge Rating to Experience Points. Use @cr to reference the CR value. Use simple math operations (+, -, *, /) and dice notation. Example: '@cr * 200 + @cr * @cr * 50'
SETTINGS.DefaultTokenVisionRangeHint: Default vision range in grid units for newly created actor tokens. All tokens start with vision enabled.
SETTINGS.EnableSystemSoundsHint: Enable or disable system sound effects.
SETTINGS.SoundSettingsHint: Configure custom sound effects for various game events.
SETTINGS.SoundSettingsDescription: Customize the sound effects used by the Eventide RP System. Leave a field blank to reset to default.
SETTINGS.SoundHealingHint: Sound played when healing is applied.
SETTINGS.SoundDamageHint: Sound played when damage is applied.
SETTINGS.SoundStatusApplyHint: Sound played when a status effect is applied.
SETTINGS.SoundStatusRemoveHint: Sound played when a status effect is removed.
SETTINGS.SoundGearEquipHint: Sound played when gear is equipped.
SETTINGS.SoundGearUnequipHint: Sound played when gear is unequipped.
SETTINGS.SoundCombatPowerHint: Sound played when a combat power is used.
SETTINGS.SoundFeatureRollHint: Sound played when a feature with roll capability is used.
SETTINGS.SoundInitiativeHint: Sound played when initiative is rolled.
SETTINGS.SoundDiceRollHint: Sound played when a dice roll is made.
SETTINGS.AllSoundsReset: All sounds reset to defaults. Click Save to apply changes.
SETTINGS.NoPlayerPermission: Players do not have permission to change sound settings.
SETTINGS.TestingModeHint: Enable or disable testing mode console logging for debugging.
SETTINGS.MinimumDiceValueHint: The minimum value that can be rolled on a dice check
SETTINGS.MaxPowerFormulaHint: Formula to calculate the maximum power for an actor. Default: max(5 + @will.total + @fort.total, 1).
SETTINGS.MaxPowerFormulaWarning: Max Power formula cannot be empty. Resetting to default.
SETTINGS.MaxResolveFormulaHint: Formula to calculate the maximum resolve for an actor. Default: max(100 + (10 * @fort.total), 10).
SETTINGS.MaxResolveFormulaWarning: Max Resolve formula cannot be empty. Resetting to default.
SETTINGS.StatPointsFormulaHint: Formula to calculate the maximum stat points for a character. Use @lvl.value for level. Set to '0' to disable color coding. Default: 14 + (2 * @lvl.value).
SETTINGS.StatPointsFormulaWarning: Stat Points formula cannot be empty. Resetting to default.
SETTINGS.MinimumPowerValueHint: The minimum value that an actor's max power can be. Applies after percentage multipliers.
SETTINGS.MinimumPowerValueWarning: Minimum Power Value must be a non-negative integer. Resetting to default ({0}).
SETTINGS.MinimumResolveValueHint: The minimum value that an actor's max resolve can be. Applies after percentage multipliers.
SETTINGS.MinimumResolveValueWarning: Minimum Resolve Value must be a positive integer (1 or greater). Resetting to default ({0}).
SETTINGS.ActionCardExecutionLimitHint: Maximum number of action cards that can be executed per turn
